sections.body:
The animals, mounts, and related gear in this section can be found in most large cities. Based on its location, a settlement might not have all of these animals or related gear available at a given time (as the GM deems fit).

The tables for this section are split up into five categories: Pets and Familiars, Guard and Hunting Animals, Farm and Work Animals, Mounts, and Animal-Related Gear. Animals that fit into more than one category appear on multiple lists.

Pets and Familiars
AnimalPriceWeight
Badger15 gp20 lbs.
Bat5 gp1 lb.
Cat3 cp8 lbs.
Cat, hunting100 gp100 lbs.
Centipede, house1 cp3 oz.
Crab20 gp5–7 lbs.
Dog, lap15 gp5 lbs.
Donkey rat1 gp50 lbs
Fox8 gp12 lbs.
Goat6 gp50 lbs.
Hedgehog5 gp3 lbs.
Lizard5 cp2 oz.
Monkey3 gp5 lbs.
Octopus25 gp2 lbs.
Otter20 gp10 lbs.
Owl10 gp1–3 lbs.

Pig10 gp100–300 lbs.
Pseudodragon200 gp7 lbs.
Rabbit2 gp3 lbs.
Raccoon5 gp7 lbs.
Rat1 cp1 lb.
Rat, dire5 gp50 lbs.
Raven2 gp3 lbs.
Scorpion, greensting15 gp9 oz.
Skunk10 gp10 lbs.
Snake, constrictor5 gp60 lbs.
Snake, viper5 gp10 oz.
Squirrel, common1 gp2 lbs.
Squirrel, flying20 gp1 lb.
Spider25 gp8 oz.
Stirge20 gp1 lb.
Thrush1 sp7 oz.
Toad2 cp7 oz.
Turtle3 gp4 lbs.
Weasel2 gp8 oz.

Animal Related Gear

Barding

Cage

Small or Medium15 gp60 lbs.
Large30 gp240 lbs.
Huge60 gp960 lbs.

Saddle

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animal Related Gear
sections.name: Animal Related Gear

sections.body: This leather or hemp harness allows a holder to restrain and control a domesticated animal. A harness is standard equipment for anyone trying to teach an animal tricks with the Handle Animal skill. Ready-made harnesses are available in most markets for common domesticated animals such as cats, dogs, horses, and oxen, but harnesses can be made for nearly any creature.
sections.name: Animal Harness
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animal Harness

sections.body: These Large avian predators are sometimes used as hunting animals but are prized as mounts.
sections.name: Axe Beak
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Axe Beak

sections.body: Axe beaks raised from eggs are easily trained as mounts or used as livestock.
sections.name: Axe Beak Egg
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Axe Beak Egg

sections.body: These fierce, burrowing creatures are only rarely kept as pets.
sections.name: Badger
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Badger

sections.body:
Barding is a type of armor that covers the head, neck, chest, body, and possibly legs of a horse or other mount. Barding made of medium or heavy armor provides better protection than light barding, but at the expense of speed. Barding can be made of any of the armor types found on the Armor and Shields table.

Armor for a horse (a Large non-humanoid creature) costs four times as much as armor for a human (a Medium humanoid creature) and also weighs twice as much (see the Armor for Unusual Creatures table). If the barding is for a pony or other Medium mount, the price is only double, and the weight is the same as for Medium armor worn by a humanoid. Medium or heavy barding slows a mount that wears it, as shown on the table below.

Flying mounts can't fly in medium or heavy barding.

Removing and fitting barding takes five times as long as the figures given on the Donning Armor table. A barded animal cannot be used to carry any load other than a rider, and normal saddlebags.
sections.name: Barding
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Barding

sections.body:
Barding(40 ft.)Base Speed (50 ft.)(60 ft.)
Medium armor30 ft.35 ft.40 ft.
Heavy armor30 ft.*35 ft.*40 ft.*
* A mount wearing heavy armor moves at only triple its normal speed when running instead of quadruple.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Barding/Barding
sections.name: Barding

sections.body: These Diminutive rodents are nocturnal fliers that eat insects and fruit. They rely primarily on sound to navigate rather than sight. They are absent only in desert and arctic regions. Some cultures keep bat houses near towns and villages to control insect problems. More information on bats can be found in the Bestiary.
sections.name: Bat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Bat

sections.body: This is headgear used by a rider to control a mount. Bit and bridles for horses, ponies, and riding dogs can be readily purchased in most settlements and bits and bridles can be crafted for any creature that serves as a mount.
sections.name: Bit and Bridle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Bit and Bridle

sections.body: This secure, portable enclosure is used to hold creatures—generally animals, but a large enough cage can hold anything. Cages are made from iron, wood, or bamboo, depending on local customs and available materials. One cage holds one animal of that size, or five animals of a smaller size. The weight of the creature adds to the weight of the cage. Cages come in the following sizes: Diminutive or Fine, Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, and Huge. Cages for aquatic creatures cost twice as much, and weigh four times the normal weight when filled with water.
sections.name: Cage
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Cage

sections.body: Due to their incredible endurance, these Large animals are the preferred mounts of desert-dwelling people. They tend to be ill-tempered beasts.
sections.name: Camel
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Camel

sections.body: These Tiny animals are often kept as pets or familiars. Though small, they are excellent hunters. Grain farmers usually keep cats for pest control in crop storage areas, but cats can be found in most regions and strays occupy many cities.
sections.name: Cat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Cat

sections.body: Rarely, Medium cats such as cheetahs and leopards are trained to hunt for humanoid masters.
sections.name: Cat, Hunting
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Cat/Hunting

sections.body: Cattle are kept for milk and meat, and used as beasts of burden. A bull is used primarily for mating. Other males are castrated and become oxen, which are used to carry loads and plow fields.
sections.name: Cattle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Cattle

sections.body: These creatures come in many forms, from the lighter-colored 20-legged variety to the darker 300-legged variety. Typically, these arthropods are what pass for pets in the slums, but the young and eccentric often search for the best specimens to serve as familiars. Centipedes employed as familiars have an Intelligence score and lose the mindless trait.
sections.name: Centipede, House
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Centipede/House

sections.body: These domesticated birds are not capable of long distance flights, and are raised for their eggs and meat. Male chickens are kept for mating and occasionally blood sport.
sections.name: Chicken
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Chicken

sections.body: Aquatic spellcasters often find large ocean crabs to be agreeable familiars. Without the bond of a familiar, however, these crustacean's lack of intelligence makes them dull pets.
sections.name: Crab
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Crab

sections.name: Dire Bat, Riding
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dire Bat/Riding

sections.body:
TypePriceWeight
Common300 gp400 lbs.
Combat trained450 gp250 lbs.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dire Bat/Riding/Type
sections.name: Type

sections.body: Considered to be the fastest nonmagical transport in cavernous underground realms, dire bats are domesticated in captivity to serve as riding animals. Stables that accommodate these massive creatures are only commonly found in cities built in larger underground caverns, owing to the greater space required for training and exercise, though the outriders of some subterranean races fly them almost to the surface. These creatures require exotic saddles to ride.
These animals are used by scouts and military for war.
sections.name: Dire Bat, Riding
Dog
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dog

sections.body:
TypePriceWeight
Guard25 gp25 lbs.
Lap15 gp5 lbs.
Riding150 gp50 lbs.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dog/Type
sections.name: Type

sections.body: Most dogs fall into one of the following categories.

This Small, combat-trained dog is bred for battle; breeders favor strength, a thick body, and a low center of gravity. Guard dogs are sold in most large cities and some cultures use them for sport fighting or in some armies' special infantry.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dog/Guard Dog
sections.name: Guard Dog

sections.body: These tiny dogs are commonly kept as pets. They cannot be combat trained, but can serve as noisy-but-skittish watch creatures. Lap dogs have the same statistics as foxes.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dog/Lap Dog
sections.name: Lap Dog

sections.body: This Medium dog is bred for carrying Small riders, and is combat trained. Breeders select dogs with strong backs, endurance, and loyal dispositions and train them for riding and combat before sale. Reputable breeders can be found in major cities.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Dog/Riding Dog
sections.name: Riding Dog

sections.body: Donkeys and mules are stolid in the face of danger, hardy, surefooted, and capable of carrying heavy loads over vast distances. Unlike a horse, a donkey or mule is willing (though not eager) to enter dungeons and other strange or threatening places. Donkeys and mules have the same statistics as ponies.
sections.name: Donkey or Mule
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Donkey or Mule

sections.body: These Tiny capybara-like white rodents are native to temperate swamps and coasts. They are common pets and livestock in some lands.
sections.name: Donkey Rat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Donkey Rat

sections.body: Farm ducks are used for eggs, meat, and down, while wild ducks are hunted for meat. Ducks have the same statistics as ravens.
sections.name: Duck
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Duck

sections.body: These Huge animals are exceptionally strong and are quick learners. Some cultures train them for battle or labor. Most known elephants come from savannas or vast rainforest regions. They eat so much that housing them outside of their native environment is expensive.
sections.name: Elephant
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Elephant

sections.body: This Tiny, long-winged hawk is a popular hunting bird among many aristocracies. Falcons are technically a subset of hawks but are considered more “noble” in many cultures. Ownership of these birds is denied to commoners in many nations with hierarchical monarchies.
sections.name: Falcon
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Falcon

sections.body: This gauntlet, made from layers of thick leather, is worn on a falconer's off hand to give a falcon a place to stand before and after the hunt. The gauntlet also has a tassel and a ring to attach to a falcon's tether.
sections.name: Falconry Gauntlet
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Falconry Gauntlet

sections.body: Horses, donkeys, mules, and ponies can graze in some regions to sustain themselves, but feed provides more reliable nourishment. Riding dogs and other carnivores can be fed meat for the same cost. Except for horses, other Large creatures need to eat twice the feed of other animals each day. Huge creatures need four times the feed.
sections.name: Feed
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Feed

sections.body: These quick and wily carnivores can be difficult to train, but often make excellent familiars. Many humanoid communities see these canines as a menace to their farming fowl, and some use dogs to track them during recreational hunts.
sections.name: Fox
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Fox

sections.name: Gecko, Riding
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Gecko/Riding

sections.body:
TypePriceWeight
Common300 gp1,200 lbs.
Combat trained400 gp1,500 lbs.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Gecko/Riding/Type
sections.name: Type

sections.body: Larger than even giant geckos, these mammoth lizards have been specifically bred to be used as mounts. Prized for their ability to run along cave ceilings and sheer walls, they require exotic saddles to ride. A riding gecko has the same statistics as a giant gecko with the giant template.
As an agricultural animal, goats provide milk, meat, hair, and hide, and they are sometimes used to clear fields of weeds and shrubbery. Some spellcasters bond with them as familiars.
sections.name: Goat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Goat

sections.body: These deadly but majestic fliers are the favored aerial cavalry of many kingdoms. While griffons can be trained, some good deities consider doing so akin to enacting slavery, insisting that a griffon must come to its rider on its own free will. The price listed is for a trained griffon; free will is bought with different currency (determined by the GM).
sections.name: Griffon
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Griffon

sections.body: Unscrupulous adventurers and the desperate sometimes steal eggs from griffon nests, as trainers find it easier to raise a griffon from a hatchling than trying to train a spirited adult.
sections.name: Griffon Egg
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Griffon Egg

sections.body: This Tiny, short-winged raptor is a popular hunting bird, but is utilized more often by lower nobility than by commoners without titles. Hawks are known for their sharp eyesight and powerful aerial dives.
sections.name: Hawk
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Hawk

sections.body: These spiny mammals roll into a ball when threatened. They are sometimes kept as pets and are favored by some wizards as familiars.
sections.name: Hedgehog
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Hedgehog

sections.body: Less intelligent and easier to train than griffons, hippogriffs make reliable winged mounts.
sections.name: Hippogriff
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Hippogriff

sections.body: While it is easier to train a full-grown hippogriff than a griffon, the eggs of these creatures are still prized by breeders.
sections.name: Hippogriff Egg
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Hippogriff Egg

sections.name: Horse
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse

sections.body:
TypePriceWeight
Heavy200 gp2,000 lbs.
Heavy, combat trained300 gp3,000 lbs.
Light75 gp900 lbs
Light, combat trained110 gp1,200 lbs.
Pony30 gp800 lbs.
Pony, combat trained45 gp900 lbs.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Type
sections.name: Type

sections.body: This Large quadruped is used as a mount and pack animal. Horses can be trained for war but otherwise are skittish around battle. Many cultures support breeding programs and often consider their horse the best at whatever task they breed it to perform.
These horses are often used as portage animals, pulling significant loads across great distances.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Heavy Horse
sections.name: Heavy Horse

sections.body: Heavy warhorses are bred and trained for war. They are often are outfitted with heavy barding, but fight just as fiercely even without the armor.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Heavy Horse (Combat Trained)
sections.name: Heavy Horse (Combat Trained)

sections.body: These horses can be ridden, but often serve as porters or carriage horses.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Light Horse
sections.name: Light Horse

sections.body: These light warhorses are bred for war and are favored by fast and light cavalry, scouts, and daredevil knights.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Light Horse (Combat Trained)
sections.name: Light Horse (Combat Trained)

sections.body: These creatures are typically used for carting goods along narrow mountain trails or as steeds for young or Small riders.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Pony
sections.name: Pony

sections.body: ): Ponies can be trained for war just as effectively as their larger, more mature brethren. Such steeds often serve Small riders that expect to face battle.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Pony (Combat Trained
sections.name: Pony (Combat Trained

sections.body: These Tiny cold-blooded animals can be found in all warm regions and are often quite colorful. They eat insects and have the ability to walk up walls and hang upside down. Varieties of more intelligent lizards are often selected by wizards as familiars.
sections.name: Lizard
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Lizard

sections.body: These cousins to elephants are larger and more powerfully built. There is a nearly hairless version that dwells in southern climates and a woolly variety adapted to cold. More temperamental than elephants, they are used primarily as mounts.
sections.name: Mastodon
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Mastodon

sections.body: These Tiny herbivorous primates can be found in a variety of habitats, but typically favor warm forests and jungles. They can grasp and carry objects that weigh under a pound. They are sometimes used as familiars.
sections.name: Monkey
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Monkey

sections.body: These cunning animals can be employed as familiars by aquatic spellcasters. If they are kept is pets, they must be kept in water, as they cannot survive out of it.
sections.name: Octopus
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Octopus

sections.body: These playful water mammals are either used as familiars or trained to perform tricks as pets. They are surprisingly intelligent, and have been known to use rocks as simple tools, such as for opening the shells of mollusks.
sections.name: Otter
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Otter

sections.body: These Tiny birds of prey are mainly nocturnal and are known for their keen eyes and near-silent flight. Owls eat small animals and insects, and can be found in nearly any environment. Some farmers create owl homes near fields and barns to control rodent populations. The smartest owls make excellent familiars.
sections.name: Owl
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Owl

sections.body: These colorful and intelligent birds can be trained to mimic humanoid voices. They are often kept as pets by the wealthy and those who live in the tropical climates they favor. Parrots have the same statistics as ravens.
sections.name: Parrot
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Parrot

sections.body: Domesticated pigs are the descendents of wild boars, and are raised for their meat and hide, being among the most versatile and common farm animals.
sections.name: Pig
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Pig

sections.body: Found primarily in temperate forests, pseudodragons are intelligent enough that some consider their sale slavery. A handful of pseudodragons offer themselves for hire to adventurers, typically for half their listed price per week of work.
sections.name: Pseudodragon
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Pseudodragon

sections.body: Rabbits are often raised or hunted for their meat and skins, though some people keep the skittish mammals as pets. Though they are often confused with hares, rabbits are distinctly different in that they make their homes in burrows beneath the ground, and they are usually smaller than hares. Rabbits have the same statistics as rats.
sections.name: Rabbit
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Rabbit

sections.body: These nocturnal hunter-scavengers are found primarily in forested terrains, and are noted for their domino mask-like visages, highly dextrous forepaws (which they rely on for their hyper-sensitive sense of touch), and the strangely anthropomorphic tendency to “wash” their food in water before eating it. Raccoons are sometimes kept as pets and used by some spellcasters as familiars.
sections.name: Raccoon
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Raccoon

sections.body: These Tiny rodents live everywhere and eat nearly anything. Despite having a reputation as disease-ridden scavengers, domesticated rats are clean, loyal creatures that make excellent familiars.
sections.name: Rat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Rat

sections.body: These Small animals are vicious scavengers in the wild. However, dire rats raised in captivity can be trained as loyal pets and protectors. Pet dire rats do not have filth fever.
sections.name: Rat, Dire
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Rat/Dire

sections.body: These Tiny birds are known for their intelligence, and even play games with each other in the wild. They eat insects and can be found in surprisingly varied habitats.
sections.name: Raven
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Raven

sections.body: Saddles are used to support a rider or supplies on a mount.
sections.name: Saddle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Saddle
pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Saddle/Military Saddle

sections.body: This saddle braces the rider, providing a +2 circumstance bonus on Ride checks related to staying in the saddle. If the rider is knocked unconscious while in a military saddle, he has a 75% chance to stay in the saddle.

sections.name: Military Saddle

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Saddle/Pack Saddle

sections.body: A pack saddle holds gear and supplies, but not a rider. It holds as much gear as the mount can carry.

sections.name: Pack Saddle

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Saddle/Riding Saddle

sections.body: These saddles are the most pervasive type of riding equipment. If the rider is knocked unconscious while in a riding saddle, he has a 50% chance to stay in the saddle.

sections.name: Riding Saddle

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Saddle/Exotic Saddle

sections.body: These saddles are designed for a variety of unusual mounts, each customized for a specific type of beast. Exotic saddles come in military, pack, and riding styles, just as normal saddles do, and have the same traits.

sections.name: Exotic Saddle

sections.body: These sturdy, weatherproof bags are draped over a saddle to add extra carrying capacity. Each side of a saddlebag can typically carry 20 pound of items that can fit in the bags. Saddlebags do not increase the amount of weight a mount can carry; they merely give riders a place to stow their equipment.
sections.name: Saddlebags
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Saddlebags

sections.body: Typically found in forested areas, these Tiny scorpions sport pincers too small to be dangerous to anything larger than an insect, but they still possess a poisonous stinger. Sometimes they are kept as pets or serve as familiars. Greensting scorpions employed as familiars have an Intelligence score and lose the mindless trait.
sections.name: Scorpion, Greensting
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Scorpion/Greensting

sections.body: These livestock animals are kept for their fur, meat, and hide, and can be found in virtually any civilized settlement. They are especially prized in colder environs, where their wool and hide can be used to make durable and highly insulated clothing. Sheep have the same statistics as goats.
sections.name: Sheep
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Sheep

sections.body: These creatures are infamous for the overwhelmingly foul odor they produce to ward off predators. Skunks are sometimes kept as pets, though usually only after their scent glands have been removed. More information on skunks can be found in Bestiary 3.
sections.name: Skunk
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Skunk

sections.body: These Medium reptiles are found chiefly in warm climates. Somewhat aggressive, constrictors squeeze their prey to death before consuming it. Due to their size, these snakes are less popular for traveling spellcasters, but they can be quite helpful in a laboratory.
sections.name: Snake, Constrictor
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Snake/Constrictor

sections.body: This tiny reptile eats small animals and can be found in most temperate and warm environments. The bite is painful but not especially dangerous to the average adventurer.
sections.name: Snake, Viper
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Snake/Viper

sections.name: Squirrel
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Squirrel

sections.body:
TypePriceWeight
Common1 gp2 lbs.
Flying20 gp1 lbs.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Squirrel/Type
sections.name: Type

sections.body: These tiny rodents are as common in the wild as rats are in cities. They typically eat nuts, seeds, and vegetation. Squirrels have the same statistics as rats.
These Tiny squirrels use a membrane of skin between their front and hind legs to glide. They sometimes serve spellcasters as familiars.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Squirrel/Flying squirrel
sections.name: Flying squirrel

sections.body: These Tiny spiders have red bodies and black legs. They are hunting spiders, so they do not cast webs, though they are poisonous.
sections.name: Spider
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Spider

sections.body: This is the amount it costs to stable a single creature that is Large or smaller for one day, at a typical stable or hostler. Particularly fancy stables may cost more, and larger or more exotic creatures cost double.
sections.name: Stabling
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Stabling

sections.body: These Tiny beasts are allegedly sold for indoor defense to rich clients, but often wind up in exotic blood sports. Despite the popular misconception that stirges are untameable vermin, such creatures are trainable, but they must be fed fresh blood daily to dissuade them from turning on their handlers.
sections.name: Stirge
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Stirge

sections.body: These small plump birds are sometimes kept as pets, but are more often used as familiars for spellcasters. They are known for their beautiful song and their potential for actual speech.
sections.name: Thrush
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Thrush

sections.body: This Diminutive amphibian is primarily kept as a familiar by spellcasters. Toads live in most temperate and warm environments, and eat insects.
sections.name: Toad
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Toad

sections.body: These reptiles have bony shells that they can retreat into. They are sometimes kept as pets and used as familiars, and in some places their flesh is eaten or used as an ingredient in medicines.
sections.name: Turtle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Turtle

sections.body: These Tiny animals eat smaller animals and can be found in nearly any environment. They are clever and curious, traits that are magnified when they are kept as familiars. Many varieties of weasel exude a strong musky odor. This description also applies to similar animals, such as ferrets, minks, polecats, and stoats.
sections.name: Weasel
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Weasel

sections.body: These shaggy-haired relatives to cows are more at home in mountainous terrain where they are frequently used as pack animals and to pull plows. Yaks have the same statistics as bison.
sections.name: Yak
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Yak

sections.name: Animals, Mounts, and Related Gear

sections.body: Transport vehicles can be purchased or hired to provide passage. The transports in this section are a number of vehicles, both common and exotic, that can be purchased or hired. The table sorts the vehicles by Land Transport and Sea Transport and includes costs to buy these vehicles or rent passage on them.
sections.name: Transports
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports

sections.body:
Transport
Land TransportPricePrice of Passage (Per Mile)
Carriage100 gp3 cp
Cart15 gp1 cp
Chariot
Chariot, light50 gp2 cp
Chariot, medium100 gp2 cp
Chariot, heavy200 gp2 cp
Dog sled20 gp3 cp
Sleigh50 gp2 cp
Wagon
Wagon, light50 gp2 cp
Wagon, medium75 gp2 cp
Wagon, heavy100 gp3 cp
Sea TransportPricePrice of Passage (Per Mile)
Galley30,000 gp1 sp
Junk15,000 gp1 sp
Keelboat3,000 gp1 sp
Longship10,000 gp5 cp
Raft—1 cp
Rowboat50 gp2 cp
Sailing ship10,000 gp2 sp
Ship's boat500 gp2 cp
Warship25,000 gp2 sp
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Transport
sections.name: Transport

sections.body: This four-wheeled vehicle can transport as many as four people within an enclosed cab, plus two drivers. In general, two horses (or other beasts of burden) draw it. A carriage comes with the harness needed to pull it.
sections.name: Carriage
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Carriage

sections.body: This two-wheeled vehicle can be drawn by a single horse or other beast of burden, and is often used to transport goods across short distances. It comes with a harness.
sections.name: Cart
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Cart

sections.body: This two-wheeled vehicle is drawn by a horse. There are three varieties of chariots.
sections.name: Chariot
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Chariot
pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Chariot/Light Chariots

sections.body: These chariots are often used for racing or as the platform for a single archer charging across the battlefield at high speed.

sections.name: Light Chariots

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Chariot/Medium Chariots

sections.body: These chariots are used in battle to break apart infantry formations or as fast-moving fighting platforms.

sections.name: Medium Chariots

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Chariot/Heavy Chariots

sections.body: This type of chariot is typically used as a fighting platform or for transporting material quickly onto the battlefield.

sections.name: Heavy Chariots

sections.body: This sled is designed to be pulled over snow and ice by a team of trained riding dogs. Most sleds have runners at the back for a musher to stand on. A dog sled can carry up to the capacity of all the dogs that pull it.
sections.name: Dog Sled
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Dog Sled

sections.body: This three-masted ship has 70 oars on either side and requires a total crew of 200. A galley is 130 feet long and 20 feet wide, and can carry 150 tons of cargo or 250 soldiers. For 8,000 gp more, it can be fitted with a ram and firing platforms fore, aft, and amidships. This ship cannot make sea voyages and sticks close to the coast. It moves about 4 miles per hour when being rowed or under sail.
sections.name: Galley
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Galley

sections.body: This flat-bottomed sailing ship has two or three masts with junk-rigged sails, allowing it to be easily sailed by small crews. Junks typically have a high poop deck and no keel.
sections.name: Junk
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Junk

sections.body: This 50- to 75-foot-long ship is 15 to 20 feet wide and has a dozen oars to supplement its single mast with a square sail. It requires a crew of 8 to 15 to sail and can carry 40 to 50 tons of cargo or 100 soldiers. It can make sea voyages, as well as sail down rivers (thanks to its flat bottom). It moves about 1 mile per hour.
sections.name: Keelboat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Keelboat

sections.body: This 75-foot-long ship with 40 oars requires a total crew of 50. It has a single mast and a square sail, and it can carry 50 tons of cargo or 120 soldiers. A longship can make sea voyages. It moves about 3 miles per hour when being rowed or under sail.
sections.name: Longship
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Longship

sections.body: The most basic and primitive type of watercraft, a raft is a simple, flat boat with no hull, often made of logs lashed together. It typically uses two to four oars for propulsion.
sections.name: Raft
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Raft

sections.body: This 8- to 12-foot-long boat with two oars holds two or three Medium passengers, and is either carried on the deck of a larger ship or moored to a dock onshore. A rowboat moves about 1-1/2 miles per hour.
sections.name: Rowboat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Rowboat

sections.body: This large, seaworthy ship is 75 to 90 feet long, 20 feet wide, and has a crew of 20. It can carry 150 tons of cargo. It has square sails on its two masts and can make sea voyages. It moves about 2 miles per hour.
sections.name: Sailing Ship
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Sailing Ship

sections.body: Ship's boats are usually carried on the decks of larger ships to ferry passengers and cargo.
sections.name: Ship's Boat
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Ships Boat

sections.body: This wagon has runners, making it an ideal conveyance for snow and ice travel. In general, two horses (or other beasts of burden) are needed to draw it. A sled comes with the harness required to pull it.
sections.name: Sleigh
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Sleigh

sections.body: This four-wheeled open vehicle is used for transporting heavy loads. It includes the harness needed to pull it. There are three common varieties of wagon.
sections.name: Wagon
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Wagon
pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Wagon/Light Wagon

sections.body: Wagons of this type are most commonly employed by farmers and craftsmen transporting their goods short distances or by venders in and around cities. A light wagon carries up to 1,000 pounds of cargo and requires two Medium creatures or one Large creature to pull it.

sections.name: Light Wagon

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Wagon/Medium Wagon

sections.body: Wagons of this type are typically employed for heavy duty work, often in agricultural, mining, or construction settings. A medium wagon can carry up to 2,000 pounds of cargo and requires four Medium or two Large creatures to pull it.

sections.name: Medium Wagon

sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Wagon/Heavy Wagon

sections.body: Wagons of this type are large, four-wheeled vehicles primarily used in caravans to transport goods over long stretches of territory. A heavy wagon carries up to 4,000 pounds of cargo, and is pulled by either eight Medium creatures or four Large creatures.

sections.name: Heavy Wagon

sections.body: This 100-foot-long ship has a single mast, although oars can also propel it. It has a crew of 60 to 80 rowers. This ship can carry 160 soldiers, but not for long distances, since there isn't room for supplies to support that many people. A warship cannot make sea voyages and sticks to the coast. It is not used for cargo. It moves about 2-1/2 miles per hour when being rowed or under sail.
sections.name: Warship
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Transports/Warship
